Name: X-RAY
Description: X-rays are a type of radiation called electromagnetic waves. X-ray imaging creates pictures of the inside of your body. X-ray imaging creates picture

Name: CT SCAN
Description: CT scanners use a rotating X-ray tube and a row of detectors placed in the gantry to measure X-ray attenuations by different tissues inside the body.

Name: MRI
Description: MRI is widely used in hospitals and clinics for medical diagnosis, staging and follow-up of disease. Compared to CT, MRI provides better contrast in images of soft-tissues, .

Name: Ultrasound
Description: Ultrasound is used in many different fields. Ultrasonic devices are used to detect objects and measure distances.

Name: Blood Function
Description: A blood test is a laboratory analysis performed on a blood sample that is usually extracted from a vein in the arm using a hypodermic needle

Name: Kidney Function
Description: The kidneys excrete a variety of waste products produced by metabolism into the urine.

Name: Liver Function
Description: The liver is an accessory digestive organ that produces bile, an alkaline fluid containing cholesterol and bile acids.

Name: Thyroid Hormone
Description: Thyroid hormones are two hormones produced and released by the thyroid gland, namely (T3) and thyroxine (T4).

Name: Urine
Description: Urine is a liquid by-product of metabolism in humans and in many other animals. Urine flows from the kidneys through the ureters to the urinary bladder.
